member.name: T:Flowly.Form1
member.summary: The main window form of the application.

member.name: F:Flowly.Form1.components
member.summary: Required designer variable.

member.name: M:Flowly.Form1.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Clean up any resources being used.
member.param: true if managed resources should be disposed; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Flowly.Form1.InitializeComponent
member.summary: Required method for Designer support - do not modify the contents of this method with the code editor.

member.name: T:Flowly.Change
member.summary: Class "Change" is meant to be used for the changes that will be made during runtime. For each activity of the user new "Change" will be created. So the "Undo" option will be available to the user.

member.name: F:Flowly.Change.description
member.summary: A string which contaions the description of a change.

member.name: T:Flowly.ComponentDrawn
member.summary: ComponentDrawn class is meant for the components that the program will have. Components as pipe, sink, merger and so on.

member.name: M:Flowly.ComponentDrawn.AddComponentDrawnToList(Flowly.ComponentDrawn)
member.summary: Adds neighbour component to listOfComponentDrawn list.

member.name: M:Flowly.ComponentDrawn.CreateConnectionPoints
member.summary: Automatically creates connection points of a component depending on its type.

member.name: M:Flowly.ComponentDrawn.SetCurrentFlow(System.Single)
member.summary: Sets the current flow (the amount of gas/liquid) going through the component.

member.name: M:Flowly.ComponentDrawn.RemoveComponentDrawnFromList(Flowly.ComponentDrawn)
member.summary: The opposite action of method AddComponentDrawnToList.

member.name: M:Flowly.ComponentDrawn.SetCapacity(System.Single)
member.summary: Sets the diffCurrFlowPossible attribute to true or false.

member.name: T:Flowly.ConnectionPoint
member.summary: "ConnectionPoint" is the place where each "Component" is connected with another one.

member.name: M:Flowly.ConnectionPoint.SetAvailable(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sets availability of a "ConnectionPoint".

member.name: M:Flowly.ConnectionPoint.SetCurrentFlow(System.Single)
member.summary: Sets the current flow going through the "ConnectionPoint". Current flow means the amount of gas or liquid going through at the moment.

member.name: T:Flowly.DialogWindow
member.summary: Meant to be used for Dialog Windows that will be opened during runtime.

member.name: M:Flowly.DialogWindow.SetPlaceAndLocation(System.String)
member.summary: Sets information to the DialogWindow's info attribute. Info as location, name...

member.name: T:Flowly.Direction
member.summary: This is an emurations containg the direction a component can face Left or right. It is used to better display the value of the direction

member.name: T:Flowly.Grid
member.summary: Objects of this class will be the "drawing" place of the user. A grid will contain components in it.

member.name: M:Flowly.Grid.AddComponentDrawnToGridList(Flowly.ComponentDrawn)
member.summary: Adds a component to the listOfComponents list.

member.name: M:Flowly.Grid.RemoveComponentDrawnFromGridList(Flowly.ComponentDrawn)
member.summary: Opposite of the other method.

member.name: T:Flowly.IDeletable
member.summary: This is an interface which allows objects to be deleted when necesery, it makes all objecets that use the interface have a method that will delete them.

member.name: M:Flowly.IDeletable.Delete
member.summary: Method that is called when an object will be deleted.

member.name: T:Flowly.IEditable
member.summary: This is an interface that enables an object to be edited

member.name: M:Flowly.IEditable.Edit
member.summary: This method is used to edit an object

member.name: T:Flowly.Merger
member.summary: Sub class of the "ComponentDrawn" class. A particular component called - Merger. Nothing specific in it. Set diffCurrFlowPossible needs to be false.

member.name: T:Flowly.Pipe
member.summary: Sub class of the "ComponentDrawn" class. A particular component called - Pipe. Nothing specific in it. Set diffCurrFlowPossible needs to be false.

member.name: T:Flowly.PropertiesEnum
member.summary: Enumeration that contains the type of propertie that can be set, if it is possible you can adjust the flow that can pass. If the component is an adjustable splitter it has the property of Adjustable. Properties: FLOW and Adjustable

member.name: T:Flowly.Pump
member.summary: Sub class of the "ComponentDrawn" class. A particular component called - Pump. Nothing specific in it. Set diffCurrFlowPossible needs to be false.

member.name: T:Flowly.Sink
member.summary: Sub class of the "ComponentDrawn" class. A particular component called - Sink. Nothing specific in it. Set diffCurrFlowPossible needs to be false.

member.name: T:Flowly.Splitter
member.summary: Sub class of the "ComponentDrawn" class. A particular component called - Splitter. SPECIFICATION: IF NORMAL SPLITTER THEN setCurrFlowPossible attribute needs to be false. IF ADJUSTABLE SPLITTER THEN setCurrFlowPossible needs to be true. Because through the two outputs of the adjustable splitter different amounts of liquid/gas can go through.

member.name: T:Flowly.SystemFlowly
member.summary: Class named "SystemFlowly". Meant to possess many of the methods to manipulate, create, delete "ComponentDrawn"-s. Has a list for "Change"-s to keep track of them. Has a list meant to be a toolbox.

member.name: F:Flowly.SystemFlowly.listOfToolboxItems
member.summary: toolbox of the program. Simpe list of "ToolboxComponent"-s. Make the difference between "ComponentDrawn" and "ToolboxComponent".

member.name: M:Flowly.SystemFlowly.CheckFreeSpot(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Checks if a particular area is free.
member.returns: True if it is, false otherwise.

member.name: M:Flowly.SystemFlowly.MakeSpotFree(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: After deleting a component makes a spot free.

member.name: M:Flowly.SystemFlowly.MakeSpotBusy(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Opposite of the above method.

member.name: M:Flowly.SystemFlowly.CreateComponentDrawn(System.String,Flowly.ConnectionPoint,Flowly.ConnectionPoint,System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates a new instance of class "ComponentDrawn".
member.returns: True if successfully created, false otherwise.

member.name: M:Flowly.SystemFlowly.DeleteComponent(Flowly.ComponentDrawn)
member.summary: Deletes a given "ComponentDrawn".

member.name: M:Flowly.SystemFlowly.EditComponentDrawn(Flowly.ComponentDrawn)
member.summary: A "ComponentDrawn" is passed and the particular componentDrawn's properties should be changed.

member.name: M:Flowly.SystemFlowly.ClearGrid(Flowly.Grid)
member.summary: Deletes all "ComponentDrawn"-s from the grid.

member.name: M:Flowly.SystemFlowly.SaveGrid(Flowly.Grid)
member.summary: Saves the current grid as a file.

member.name: M:Flowly.SystemFlowly.NewFile
member.summary: Creates a new grid.

member.name: M:Flowly.SystemFlowly.OpenFile
member.summary: Opens already created and saved grid.

member.name: M:Flowly.SystemFlowly.UndoLastChange
member.summary: Goes back to a state before a change is made.

member.name: M:Flowly.SystemFlowly.CreateChange(System.String)
member.summary: Always the user makes a change, a new instance of "Change" class is created.

member.name: T:Flowly.ToolboxComponent
member.summary: Not a "ComponentDrawn"! This is a Component from the Toolbox! Can be just used to CREATE an instance of "ComponentDrawn"!

member.name: T:Flowly.NamespaceDoc
member.summary: This namespace contains all the classes that the Flowly Windows forms uses. Inside there are brief descriptions of each class and their methods.

member.name: M:Flowly.Program.Main
member.summary: The main entry point for the application.

member.name: T:Flowly.Properties.Resources
member.summary: A strongly-typed resource class, for looking up localized strings, etc.

member.name: P:Flowly.Properties.Resources.ResourceManager
member.summary: Returns the cached ResourceManager instance used by this class.

member.name: P:Flowly.Properties.Resources.Culture
member.summary: Overrides the current thread's CurrentUICulture property for all resource lookups using this strongly typed resource class.
